column4: alright guys got a good one here.. need to recover a file without extensions....
specifically what do you need to do, did you accidentaly delete the file? also what filesystem is it on?
ext4 file system i've move the file and now there is nothing in it
what command did you use to move the file?
ouch, that may make things more difficult, I am assuming, as you are using ext4, that the system is 9.10 (karmic)
do you have a partial copy of the text, or even and EXACT copy of one or more lines in the text?
i know what could have been in the text
i know what could have been in the text ....

ok the best thing to do here would be shutdown the machine and reboot in from a live cd, then come back here for further help, basically you will need to do somthing like sudo grep -i -a -U -Bx -Ay 'known text from file' /dev/sda1 | tee /tmp/recovered.txt      this assumes that the drive is /dev/sda and the partition the file is on is partition 1. also you will need to change the -Bx to -B10 (for example) and -Ay to -A10 (for example).
ok so i boot with karmic cd live and then come back here and you explain me this ?
Yes I can try, unfortunately the grep (which is a search) can take a very long time for something like this.
has to be from live cd ?
basically that is the best way, the longer you are running the machine with the harddrive mounted, the more chance you have of permanently obliterating the data you want to retrieve
give me a couple of minutes
I have just private messaged you
